intro: Aciotis purpurascens var. martinensis, commonly known as the Martin's purpleleaf dandelion, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It is characterized by its hairy, lance-shaped leaves and bright yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. It is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Its medicinal properties have been studied for potential use in traditional herbal remedies.
